blocks.text: Model the generation job and its output. Keep the schema small so the UI can render jobs, progress, and results.

**How you should frame it:**
"I model each generation as a Job with status, prompt, and output URLs. The UI renders a list of jobs and shows the active one."

**What the interviewer listens for:**
- Clear job status field.
- Output URL stored separately from prompt.
- Metadata to render history.
- Error fields for failures.

blocks.title: How you should act here
blocks.text: Keep the model simple: prompt, status, progress, and output URL. That is enough for an MVP UI.

blocks.title: Things you should model explicitly
items: Output URL for the generated image.
A list of recent jobs for history.

blocks.title: Common data model gaps
items: No status field, so UI cannot show progress.
No job id, so polling is impossible.
Embedding base64 images instead of URLs.
No history list, so users lose past results.

items.label: Primary entity
items.helperText: Everything revolves around the job lifecycle.

blocks.title: Key message to land
blocks.text: An MVP data model should be tiny and UI-driven: prompt, status, progress, and output URL.
